message.content:
Answering Telephones and Directing Calls

Responsibilities

1. Answer all incoming calls promptly and professionally, using a friendly and courteous tone. 2. Identify the caller's purpose and determine the urgency of the call. 3. Direct the caller to the appropriate staff member, department, or service. 4. Take messages and relay them to the intended recipient in a timely manner. 5. Handle calls from patients, families, and healthcare providers with sensitivity and discretion.

Procedure

1. Answer the phone on the first ring, using a professional greeting. 2. Identify yourself and the medical practice or facility. 3. Ask the caller to state their name, reason for calling, and any relevant information. 4. Determine the caller's purpose and direct them to the appropriate staff member or department. 5. Take messages and provide the caller with an estimated wait time or a callback time. 6. Document all calls, including messages and caller information, in the designated log or system.

Best Practices

1. Maintain a calm and professional demeanor when handling calls, even in high-pressure situations. 2. Use active listening skills to fully understand the caller's needs and concerns. 3. Be respectful and empathetic when dealing with sensitive or emotional situations. 4. Ensure that all calls are handled in a timely and efficient manner, minimizing wait times and delays. 5. Continuously update and refine your phone skills and knowledge to provide exceptional customer service.
